thread.title: Queen all smiles on eve of historic milestone
thread.title_full: Queen all smiles on eve of historic milestone | Anglia - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Queen all smiles on eve of historic milestone
text:
The Queen will become the first British monarch to reach her Sapphire anniversary Credit: PA The Queen greets crowds at West Newton church near Sandringham Credit: PA Well-wishers were greeted with a smile as the Queen went on a walkabout ahead of becoming the first British monarch to reach their Sapphire Jubilee.
The 90 year-old looked pleased as she gathered up bouquets from the waiting crowds after the church service at St Peter and St Paul in West Newton, Norfolk.
Three-year-old Jessica Atfield, who dressed specially for the occasion in a Union flag skirt, was delighted when she got to hand over a bunch of flowers to the Queen.
Tomorrow is the anniversary of the day that Elizabeth II came to the throne. She has now reigned for 65 years.
Accession Day will, as usual though, be a low key affair.
The Queen will be spending it privately at her Sandringham Estate in Norfolk and no grand celebrations have been planned.
The Queen, dressed in an aquamarine blue and black dress and coat, was joined at the church service by the Duke of Edinburgh.
Crowds gathering outside the church at West Newton Credit: ITV Anglia Last updated Sun 5 Feb 2017 Royal Norfolk
